_metadata.data_source: Nuvalent Overview January 12, 2026; Sun Y. et al AACR 2024, AACR-NCI-EORTC 2025

biology.function: HER2 is a receptor tyrosine kinase that when mutated (especially exon 20 insertions), amplified, or overexpressed drives tumor growth through oncogenic signaling

mutation_types.exon_20_insertions: Most common (e.g., YVMA insertion, GSP insertion)
mutation_types.amplification: Wild-type HER2 gene copy number increase

genetic_validation.oncogenic_driver: Yes - HER2 mutations and amplifications are validated oncogenic drivers in NSCLC
genetic_validation.predictive_biomarker: HER2 mutation status by NGS; HER2 amplification by FISH/IHC
genetic_validation.therapeutic_precedent: T-DXd (ADC, accelerated approval); Zongertinib (TKI, accelerated approval); Multiple investigational HER2 TKIs

rationale: Validated oncogenic driver with emerging therapeutic options
Current TKIs have EGFR-related toxicities (skin rash, diarrhea) or suboptimal CNS activity
ADC (T-DXd) has chemotherapy-like safety profile (30% serious adverse reactions)
High rate of CNS progression warrants brain-penetrant therapies
unmet_need: No approved HER2 TKI with both strong CNS activity AND EGFR-sparing profile
Treatment-limiting adverse events with pan-ERBB inhibitors
Suboptimal CNS activity with some approved/investigational agents

mechanism.binding_mode: ATP-competitive kinase inhibitor designed to selectively inhibit HER2 while sparing EGFR

selectivity_profile.her2_vs_egfr: High selectivity for HER2 and HER2 mutants over wild-type EGFR

comparison_to_competitors.vs_poziotinib: Greater selectivity for HER2ex20 over EGFR than pan-ERBB inhibitors
comparison_to_competitors.vs_zongertinib: Similar HER2 activity with potentially improved brain penetration

in_vitro_activity.her2_wild_type_amp: Potent activity in NCI-H2170, BT-474, NCI-N87 (HER2amp) cell lines
in_vitro_activity.her2_ex20ins: Potent activity against HER2YVMA, HER2VC, HER2GSP insertions
in_vitro_activity.her2_point_mutations: Activity against S310F, R678Q, L755S, G776V, V777L, V777M, V842I

brain_penetration.comparison: Similar to preclinical observations for lorlatinib

preclinical_intracranial_efficacy.observation: NVL-330 induced intracranial tumor regression in mice progressing on zongertinib
preclinical_intracranial_efficacy.zongertinib_exposure: 30 mg/kg BID (estimated above approved human doses of 120-180 mg QD)
preclinical_intracranial_efficacy.crossover_response: 84% tumor reduction with NVL-330 after 124% increase on zongertinib

trial_design.design: First-in-human, BOIN dose-escalation with dose expansion

phase_1a.population: HER2 mutation or HER2 amplification allowed

key_eligibility.prior_therapy: â‰¥1 prior systemic therapy including platinum-based chemotherapy +/- immunotherapy
key_eligibility.prior_her2_tkis: Excluded (prior selective HER2 TKI; note: prior HER2 antibodies and ADCs allowed)
key_eligibility.exclusions: Concurrent oncogenic drivers (EGFR, BRAF, MET, ROS1, ALK, RET)

clinical_data.status: Early-stage enrollment; no efficacy data disclosed yet

limitations: May have suboptimal CNS activity based on preclinical comparisons

standard_of_care.1L: Pemetrexed + Platinum + Pembrolizumab (48% ORR, 11.2 month mDOR, 8.8 month mPFS)

design_goals: HER2 activity including wild-type (amplified) and mutant
EGFR-sparing to avoid skin rash and diarrhea
preclinical_advantages: Broad HER2 activity covering mutations, insertions, and amplification
Greater selectivity for HER2 over EGFR than pan-ERBB inhibitors
Superior brain penetration vs zongertinib in preclinical models

investment_analysis.stage_value: Early Phase 1 - highest risk, highest upside optionality
investment_analysis.differentiation_strength: Potentially strong if CNS activity and EGFR-sparing confirmed clinically
investment_analysis.competitive_position: Differentiated design vs approved options; clinical proof-of-concept pending
investment_analysis.data_quality: Preclinical only; no clinical efficacy data yet
investment_analysis.regulatory_pathway: Standard IND-to-approval; years from potential approval

key_commercial_factors: CNS activity differentiation vs zongertinib could be significant
EGFR-sparing profile may improve tolerability vs pan-ERBB TKIs
ADC competitor (T-DXd) has different safety/convenience profile

key_data_to_watch: CNS responses in patients with brain metastases
